elements.content: ‡ Syntheses: Mn(NCS)2(pzdo)21: this was carried out by mixing an aqueous solution of MnCl2·4H2O (0.5 mmol, 12.5 ml) with a aqueous solution of NaNCS (2.5 mmol, 12.5 ml). After stirring for 1 h at ca. 80 °C an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml) was added. The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After two weeks, a prismatic, purple, X-ray quality single crystal was obtained (yield 60%) (Calc.: C, 30.08; H, 2.02, N, 21.05. Found: C, 30.12; H, 2.16; N, 20.09%).Co(NCS)2(pzdo)22: this was obtained by mixing an aqueous solution of Co(NCS)2 (0.25 mmol, 2.85 ml), with an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml). The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After several days red prismatic crystals appeared (yield, 70%) (Calc.: C, 30.39; H, 2.04; N, 21.26. Found: C, 30.47; H, 2.117; N, 20.45%).
elements.clean_text: ‡ Syntheses:  Mn(NCS)2(pzdo)21: this was carried out by mixing an aqueous solution of MnCl2⋅4H2O (0.5 mmol, 12.5 ml) with a aqueous solution of NaNCS (2.5 mmol, 12.5 ml). After stirring for 1 h at ca. 80 °C an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml) was added. The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After two weeks, a prismatic, purple, X-ray quality single crystal was obtained (yield 60%) (Calc.: C, 30.08; H, 2.02, N, 21.05. Found: C, 30.12; H, 2.16; N, 20.09%).Co(NCS)2(pzdo)22: this was obtained by mixing an aqueous solution of Co(NCS)2 (0.25 mmol, 2.85 ml), with an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml). The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After several days red prismatic crystals appeared (yield, 70%) (Calc.: C, 30.39; H, 2.04; N, 21.26. Found: C, 30.47; H, 2.117; N, 20.45%).

elements.content: 1mixing2mixing§ Crystal data: compound 1: C10H8MnN6O4S2, M = 395.28, triclinic, space group P, a = 6.9405(2), b = 7.1938(3), c = 8.2566(4) Å, α = 82.237(3), β = 66.892(3), γ = 74.971(3)°, U = 365.94(3) Å3, Z = 1, Dc = 1.794 Mg m−3, μ(Mo-Kα) = 1.216 mm−1, F(000) = 199, GoF = 1.219. A total of 6971 reflections were collected and 1662 are unique (Rint = 0.0353). R1 and wR2 are 0.0443 and 0.1209, respectively, for 107 parameters and 1518 reflections [I > 2σ(I)].Compound 2: C10H8CoN6O4S2, M = 399.27, triclinic, space group P, a = 6.8922(14), b = 7.1528(14), c = 8.1074(16) Å, α = 82.49(3) β = 67.26(3)°, γ = 74.06(3)°, U = 354.31(12) Å3, Z =1, Dc = 1.871, μ = 1.536 mm−1, F(000) = 201, GoF = 0.999. A total of 7110 reflections were collected and 1664 are unique (Rint = 0.040). R1 and wR2 are 0.0306 and 0.0722, respectively, for 107 parameters and 1406 reflections [I > 2σ(I)].The data were collected on a Nonius Kappa CCD with Mo-Kα radiation (λ = 0.71073 Å) at 293 K. The structures were solved by direct methods and refined by a full matrix least squares technique based on F2 using the SHELXL 97 program.CCDC reference numbers 169675 and 16976.See http://www.rsc.org/suppdata/cc/b1/b107334f/ for crystallographic data in CIF or other electronic format.

cln_elements.content: Pyrazine dioxide bridged two-dimensional antiferromagnets [M(NCS)2(pzdo)2] (M = Mn, Co; pzdo = pyrazine dioxide)†pyrazine Hao-Ling Sun Bao-Qing Ma Song Gao and Gang Su polymerspyrazine dioxideligandpolymerCyanoazidodicyanamideligandspolymers1pyrazine4,4′-bipyridine2azide3methyl isonicotinate4ligands5ligandpolymers12X-Ray diffraction12ligandsligands4,4′-bipyridine dioxide127 Two-dimensional grid for 2. Selected bond distances (Å) and angles (°): Mn(1)–N(3) 2.114(4), Mn(1)–O(1) 2.208(3), Mn(1)–O(2) 2.226(3). For 2: Co(1)–N(3) 2.045(2), Co(1)–O(1) 2.1116(15), Co(1)–O(2) 2.1315(16). ‡ Syntheses: Mn(NCS)2(pzdo)21: this was carried out by mixing an aqueous solution of MnCl2·4H2O (0.5 mmol, 12.5 ml) with a aqueous solution of NaNCS (2.5 mmol, 12.5 ml). After stirring for 1 h at ca. 80 °C an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml) was added. The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After two weeks, a prismatic, purple, X-ray quality single crystal was obtained (yield 60%) (Calc.: C, 30.08; H, 2.02, N, 21.05. Found: C, 30.12; H, 2.16; N, 20.09%).Co(NCS)2(pzdo)22: this was obtained by mixing an aqueous solution of Co(NCS)2 (0.25 mmol, 2.85 ml), with an aqueous solution of pzdo (0.50 mmol, 10 ml). The resulting solution was allowed to stand at room temperature after stirring for 0.5 h. After several days red prismatic crystals appeared (yield, 70%) (Calc.: C, 30.39; H, 2.04; N, 21.26. Found: C, 30.47; H, 2.117; N, 20.45%).

metadata.title: Pyrazine dioxide bridged two-dimensional antiferromagnets [M(NCS) 2 (pzdo) 2 ] (M = Mn, Co; pzdo = pyrazine dioxide)
